# crowdstrike_content_update_policies (Data Source)

Content Update Policies --- This data source provides information about content update policies in Falcon.

## Required Scopes

**Content update policies**: `read`

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Get all content update policies
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "all" {}

# Filter content update policies by enabled status
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "enabled_only" {
  enabled = true
}


# Get specific content update policies by IDs
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "specific" {
  ids = ["policy-id-1", "policy-id-2"]
}

# Use FQL filter for advanced queries
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "advanced_filter" {
  filter = "enabled:true"
  sort   = "name.asc"
}

# Filter by platform and enabled status
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "combined" {
  platform = "windows"
  enabled  = true
}
```

## Schema

### Optional

- `enabled` (Boolean) Filter policies by enabled status. Cannot be used together with 'filter' or 'ids'.
- `filter` (String) FQL filter to apply to the content update policies query. When specified, only policies matching the filter will be returned. Cannot be used together with 'ids' or other filter attributes. Example: `enabled:true`
- `ids` (List of String) List of content update policy IDs to retrieve. When specified, only policies with matching IDs will be returned. Cannot be used together with 'filter' or other filter attributes.
- `platform` (String) Filter policies by platform. Valid values include 'windows', 'mac', 'linux'. Cannot be used together with 'filter' or 'ids'.
- `sort` (String) Sort order for the results. Valid values include field names with optional '.asc' or '.desc' suffix. Example: 'name.asc', 'created_timestamp.desc'

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Identifier for this data source
- `policies` (List of Object) The list of content update policies (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--policies))

<a id="nestedblock--policies"></a>
### Nested Schema for `policies`

Read-Only:

- `created_by` (String) User who created the policy
- `created_timestamp` (String) Timestamp when the policy was created
- `description` (String) The content update policy description
- `enabled` (Boolean) Whether the content update policy is enabled
- `groups` (List of String) List of host group IDs assigned to the policy
- `id` (String) The content update policy ID
- `modified_by` (String) User who last modified the policy
- `modified_timestamp` (String) Timestamp when the policy was last modified
- `name` (String) The content update policy name

## Advanced Usage

### Using FQL Filters

The `filter` attribute accepts Falcon Query Language (FQL) expressions for advanced filtering:

```terraform
# Filter by multiple criteria  
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "complex" {
  filter = "enabled:true+platform_name:'windows'"
}

# Filter by creation date (if supported)
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "recent" {
  filter = "created_timestamp:>'2024-01-01'"
}
```

### Sorting Results

Use the `sort` attribute to control the order of results:

```terraform
# Sort by name (ascending)
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "sorted" {
  sort = "name.asc"
}

# Sort by creation time (descending)
data "crowdstrike_content_update_policies" "newest_first" {
  sort = "created_timestamp.desc"
}
```

### Error Handling

The data source validates that only one filtering method is used at a time:

- Use `filter` for FQL-based queries
- Use `ids` for retrieving specific policies by ID
- Use individual attributes (`enabled`, `platform`) for simple filtering

Attempting to combine these methods will result in a validation error.
